ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: It would be helpful us students will get a more chance to learn 'what agrarian society' is and what is the main topics discussed among scholars. Some students take this class without any background in anthropology and history.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The diversity of readings and the discussion were both enjoyable. The short responses offer a great way to more thoroughly engage with some of the readings of most interest. Additionally, the freedom around the type of final paper we could write was also valuable.
Getting to know the knowledge in the field. Also getting to know the students from different department

The best aspects of this course were the following: 1. A diverse set of peers from the university interested in similar themes; I could build a good network of colleagues 2. Exposure to numerous themes and regions that I was not otherwise engaged with 3. Great faculty

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: some reading materials are updated just a few days before the class.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: For the most part; because the course was team taught some reading/lecture/discussion combinations were better than others. Personally I found Prof. Mikhail and Prof. Siviramakrishnan's classes the most helpful, coherent, and engaging; they also engaged the class better in the discussion sections.
effective, we got a lot of chance to discuss what we learned through the lecture

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
Why did you take this course?
comments: General interest in agrarian socialites and agriculture

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Consider the areas of expertise of each professor teaching the course and whether, in the majority, the course will offer you content that is relevant to your interests and goals.
Lots of ratings but you will get out of it!
